alert.note: Alert for Alamosa; Conejos; Costilla; Rio Grande; Saguache (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 12:17PM MST until February 22 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Alamosa County in southeastern Colorado... Eastern Rio Grande County in south central Colorado... Southeastern Saguache County in central Colorado... Western Costilla County in south central Colorado... Conejos County in south central Colorado... * Until 100 PM MST. * At 1215 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 11 miles southwest of Monte Vista, or 22 miles west of Alamosa, moving northeast at 55 mph. Winds of 40 to 50 mph were occurring at the Alamosa airport. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 20 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Highways 285 and highways 160 will be affected by this snow squall. Locations impacted include... Alamosa, Monte Vista, Center, Del Norte, Manassa, Sanford, La Jara, Antonito, San Luis, Romeo, Blanca, Moffat, Hooper, Capulin, San Pablo, Alamosa East, Mesita, La Garita, Sanchez Reservoir and San Luis Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED

area.areaDesc: Alamosa; Conejos; Costilla; Rio Grande; Saguache
